meanings.definition: A person who remains aloof or independent, especially from party politics.
meanings.sent1: At the meeting, the mugwumps stayed quiet and didn't join any group.
meanings.sent2: During the election, some people were called mugwumps because they didn't support any party.
meanings.sent3: The mugwumps at the debate seemed like they were on their own little island.
meanings.sent4: She was a mugwump in the sea of political opinions, standing out like a lone tree in a field.
meanings.sent5: The image of a mugwump sitting alone at the political rally stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A person who is neutral or undecided in a political situation.
meanings.sent1: The mugwumps couldn't decide which candidate to support.
meanings.sent2: Being a mugwump in the election meant not taking sides.
meanings.sent3: The group of mugwumps looked like they were waiting for a sign from above.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a mugwump in the middle of a heated debate, unsure which side to choose.
meanings.sent5: The image of a mugwump teetering on a fence perfectly captured her indecision.

meanings.definition: A person who is independent or nonconformist in their views or actions.
meanings.sent1: The artist was a true mugwump, creating art that defied all norms.
meanings.sent2: In a sea of traditional thinkers, she stood out as a mugwump with her unique ideas.
meanings.sent3: The mugwump of the group always had a surprising take on things.
meanings.sent4: He was a mugwump in the world of fashion, setting trends instead of following them.
meanings.sent5: The image of a mugwump dancing to their own tune was both inspiring and refreshing.
